Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: AMENDMENT TO NETWORK SERVICES AND INTERNET2 ACCESS AGREEMENT BETWEEN MEMPHIS COALITION FOR ADVANCED NETWORKING AND THE UNIVERSITY OF MEMPHIS The following terms and conditions, as applicable, (collectively, the “Amendment”) shall amend, modify, add or delete certain other terms and conditions to the above-referenced Agreement (“Agreement”) between MEMPHIS COALITION FOR ADVANCED NETWORKING (“MCAN”) and THE UNIVERSITY OF MEMPHIS ("UoM"), and are incorporated thereunto by reference and made an integral part thereof. The terms and conditions of the Agreement shall control in the event same conflict with any term or condition of this Amendment, except as explicitly provided in the changes below. A. In Section 2, Price and Payment, fourth sentence, “by the UoM” is deleted. B. In Section 2, Price and Payment, the following sentences are added to this Section: “The amount of compensation UoM shall be entitled to in the event of termination for unavailable funds shall be limited to funds due pro rata at the termination date as illustrated in Exhibit A to this Amendment. The maximum liability of MCAN under this Agreement is $ 970,005.00.” C. Unless terminated as provided herein, the term of this Agreement is from July 1, 2009 to December 31, 2013. It is the intent of the parties to negotiate in good faith prior to the end of the term to enter into a mutually acceptable renewal of this Agreement. D. In Section 4, Confidential Information, Subpart A, first sentence, “or if disclosure is required by law” is added to the end of that sentence. E. In Section 4, Confidential Information, Subpart B, first sentence, “or if disclosure is required by law” is added to the end of that sentence. F. In Section 6, Warranty and Disclaimer, heading, “Warranty and” is deleted from heading. G. In Section 6, Warranty and Disclaimer, fourth sentence, deleted in its entirety. H. In Section 10, Arbitration, heading, “Arbitration” is deleted and replaced with “Mediation”. I. In Section 10, Arbitration, first sentence is deleted in its entirety and replaced with “Any dispute arising under this Agreement shall be subject to mediation by a mutually agreeable Tennessee Supreme Court Rule 31 Mediator. Disputes that persist after mediation shall be submitted to the Board of Claims or Claims Commission of the State of Tennessee.” J. In Section 10, Arbitration, third sentence, “arbitration” is deleted and replaced with “mediation.” K. In Section 10, Arbitration, fourth sentence, deleted in its entirety. L. In Section 10, Arbitration, fifth sentence, “Arbitrator” is deleted and replaced with “Mediator.” M. In Exhibit B: Statement of Pricing, Section 2, line 1, “$ 90,000” is changed to “$ 90,001”. N. In Exhibit B: Statement of Pricing, Section 2, lines 2 through 5, “$ 220,000” is changed to $220,001”. O. To the extent required by law or regulation, MCAN shall comply with Titles VI and VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Sections 503/504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, Executive Order 11,246, and 38 USC Section 4212, along with the related regulations and reporting requirements of each. Neither party to the Agreement and this Amendment shall discriminate against any individual including, but not limited to, employees or applicants for employment and/or students because of race, religion, creed, color, sex, age, disability, national origin, or status as a disabled or Vietnam era veteran. Further, the parties agree to take such affirmative action as required by applicable law or regulation to ensure that applicants are employed and that employees are treated during their employment without regard to their race, religion, creed, color, sex, age, disability, national origin, or status as a disabled or Vietnam Era veteran. Such action includes, but not be limited to, the following: employment, promotion, upgrading, demotion or transfer, recruitment, advertising, layoff or terminations, rates of pay or other forms of compensation, and selection for training, including apprenticeship. Actual or alleged failure to comply with the laws and regulations cited in this Section O shall not be deemed a breach of the terms and conditions of the Agreement or this Amendment and shall be subject only to such penalties and remedies as are required by applicable law or regulation. P. MCAN shall maintain records pertaining to this Agreement for a period of three (3) years from the date of final payment and shall be subject to audit, at reasonable time and upon reasonable notice, by the Comptroller of the Treasury of the State of Tennessee or their duly appointed representatives. Q. MCAN attests that no fee has been nor shall be paid directly or indirectly to any officer or employee of the State of Tennessee as wages, compensation, or gifts in exchange for acting as officer, agent, employee, subcontractor or consultant to MCAN in connection with this Agreement. R. Neither party shall be responsible for personal injury or property damage or other loss suffered by any person or entity except that resulting from its own negligence, and nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as creating an obligation to indemnify the other party against that party’s own negligence. S. Any and all claims against the State of Tennessee, including UoM or its employees, for personal injury and/or property damage resulting from the negligence of the UoM in performing any responsibility specifically required under the terms for this Agreement such as may persist after non-binding mediation as outlined in Section 10 of the original Agreement and in Section I of this Amendment, shall be submitted to the Board of Claims or Claims Commission of the State of Tennessee. Damages recoverable against UoM shall be expressly limited to claims approved by the Board of Claims or Claims Commission pursuant to T.C.A. Section 9-8-301, et. seq. Subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Amendment, the Agreement dated July 1, 2009 between the parties is hereby ratified and confirmed. Russell Ingram Typed Name President Title February 19, 2010 Date THE UNIVERSITY OF MEMPHIS Typed Name Wj^uo»>.president TBRl \ 1 Approved: "fib-------- Date I
